definitions.definition: Diabetes mellitus ; any of a group of metabolic diseases whereby a person (or other animal) has high blood sugar due to an inability to produce, or inability to metabolize, sufficient quantities of the hormone insulin .
Any food or beverage with a high amount of sugar .
Diabetes insipidus ; any condition characterized by excessive or incontinent urine , now specifically as caused by impaired production of, or response to, the antidiuretic hormone vasopressin .

main_definition: ( pathology ) Diabetes mellitus ; any of a group of metabolic diseases whereby a person (or other animal) has high blood sugar due to an inability to produce, or inability to metabolize, sufficient quantities of the hormone insulin . [from 19th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( slang , humorous ) Any food or beverage with a high amount of sugar .

Diabetes insipidus ; any condition characterized by excessive or incontinent urine , now specifically as caused by impaired production of, or response to, the antidiuretic hormone vasopressin . [from 15th c.]
